name: CloudFlare integration for Piwik
description: Integrate Piwik open source web analytics into your site.

details.Price: Free to install, free to use. Bring your own Piwik server.

interface.name: Piwik Site Id
interface.description: The id of the your Piwik site. (HINT: It's usually 1 unless you are tracking more than one domain)

interface.name: Piwik server url
interface.description: The domain name of your Piwik install. (If you include the protocol, like https:// it will override the SSL setting)

interface.name: Use SSL
interface.description: Select yes if your Piwik server support HTTPS connections.

interface.name: Enable client side DoNotTrack detection
interface.description: Tracking requests will not be sent if visitors do not wish to be tracked. Note: If server side DoNotTrack support has been enabled, this option will have no effect.

interface.name: Track visitors across all sub-domains
interface.description: If no, when one visitor visits x.domain.com and y.domain.com, they will be counted as a unique visitor.

interface.name: Prepend the site domain to the page title when tracking
interface.description: If someone visits the 'About' page on blog.domain.com it will be recorded as 'blog / About'. This is the easiest way to get an overview of your traffic by sub-domain.
